question: The "Champagne Reef" is located in which country?
explanation: The Champagne Reef, a famous diving and snorkelling site, is located in the island country of Dominica, officially the Commonwealth of Dominica, in the Windward Islands of the LesserAntilles Archipelago. The speciality of the Champagne Reef is the bubbling waters which rise from volcanic thermal springs on the ocean floor. This reef is full of tropical fish, hawksbill turtles and shipwreck remains. Champagne Reef is part of the Soufriere Scott's Head Marine Reserve, one of the three marine parks of Dominica.
